definition: (literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: Quieten those children down , I can not hear myself talk.
sentences.chinese: 讓孩子們安靜下來，我都聽不見自己講話了。
“我們聽不見你說話，”有人喊道。

sentences.english: You didn't know I was farting because they don't smell and are silent.
sentences.chinese: 但你並不知道，這是因爲它聞不到聽不見。

sentences.english: I couldnt hear what he said because the radio was so loud.
sentences.chinese: 我聽不見他說些什麼，因爲收音機的聲音太大了。
馬蹄聲逐漸地聽不見了。

sentences.english: Speak out; we can't hear you.
sentences.chinese: 大聲點，我們聽不見你在說什麼。

sentences.english: He spoke; but he was too far off, and we did not hear.
sentences.chinese: 他對我們講話，但是他站得太靠裏了，我們聽不見。

sentences.english: These very high frequency sounds are inaudible to the human ear.
sentences.chinese: 這些頻率非常高的聲音人耳是聽不見的。

sentences.english: What did you say? I can't hear you when the water is running.
sentences.chinese: 你說什麼？水龍頭正開着，我聽不見你說的話。

sentences.english: And interestingly enough, you can't hear radio waves.
sentences.chinese: 更有意思的是，你也聽不見無線電波。

sentences.english: Instead there's only silence, can't you hear my screams?
sentences.chinese: 但此時只有寂靜，難道你聽不見我的呼喚聲嗎？

sentences.english: Blossom of snow floats surprise, I hear.
sentences.chinese: 花開雪飄的驚喜，我聽不見。

sentences.english: Could you speak loudly, i can't hear you.
sentences.chinese: 我聽不見你說的，能大聲點嗎？

sentences.english: I tried to walk quietly, so that they would not hear me.
sentences.chinese: 我設法悄悄地行走，俾使他們聽不見。

sentences.english: Quieten those children , I can not hear myself .
sentences.chinese: 讓孩子們安靜下來，我都聽不見自己講話了。

definition: to fiddle with/to tamper with/to meddle with/to move randomly/to flail about
Jiang Yan has exhausted his talent (idiom)/fig. to have used up one's creative powers/to have writer's block
to turn tears into laughter (idiom); to turn grief into happiness
to act willfully and make a scene/to make trouble
